pullRequest.body:
Splits `Topology.Perfect` into two modules: `Topology.Perfect`, where the existing definition of `Perfect` and `Preperfect` are kept, and `Topology.MetricSpace.Perfect`, in which the theorems specific to metric spaces are moved.

---

This PR is part of my effort to formalize Rubin's theorem into Mathlib.
See https://leanprover.zulipchat.com/#narrow/stream/287929-mathlib4/topic/Defining.20perfect.20spaces for the zulip discussion on this subject.

<!-- The text above the `---` will become the commit message when your
PR is merged. Please leave a blank newline before the `---`, otherwise
GitHub will format the text above it as a title.

To indicate co-authors, include lines at the bottom of the commit message
(that is, before the `---`) using the following format:

Co-authored-by: Author Name <author@email.com>

Any other comments you want to keep out of the PR commit should go
below the `---`, and placed outside this HTML comment, or else they
will be invisible to reviewers.

If this PR depends on other PRs, please list them below this comment,
using the following format:
- [ ] depends on: #abc [optional extra text]
- [ ] depends on: #xyz [optional extra text]
-->

[![Open in Gitpod](https://gitpod.io/button/open-in-gitpod.svg)](https://gitpod.io/from-referrer/)

nodes.body: Did you change the code that you move to the new file? Github doesn't show a highlighted `diff` for these lines.

I only made changes to the proof body of `Perfect.exists_nat_bool_injection`, and these were replacing `refine'` with `refine`, replacing the call to `continuity` with a manual proof and changing mid-proof `simp`s with `simp only`s. Here's what diff says (the line numbers start from the first theorem moved, `Perfect.small_diam_aux`):

```diff
56c56
<     refine' Antitone.closureAntitone _ fun l => (DP l).property.1.closed
---
>     refine Antitone.closureAntitone ?canto_antitone fun l => (DP l).property.1.closed
64c64
<     · simp
---
>     · simp only [zero_le, eventually_atTop, ge_iff_le, implies_true, forall_const, exists_const]
66c66
<     refine' ⟨1, fun m (hm : 1 ≤ m) => _⟩
---
>     refine ⟨1, fun m (hm : 1 ≤ m) => ?diam_le⟩
69,74c69,73
<     dsimp
<     cases x n
<     · convert (h0 _ _ _).2.2.2
<       rw [PiNat.res_length]
<     convert (h1 _ _ _).2.2.2
<     rw [PiNat.res_length]
---
>     dsimp only [PiNat.res_succ]
> 
>     cases x n <;> rw [PiNat.res_length]
>     · exact (h0 _ _ _).2.2.2
>     · exact (h1 _ _ _).2.2.2
82c81
<   refine' ⟨fun x => (inducedMap D).2 ⟨x, hdom⟩, _, _, _⟩
---
>   refine ⟨fun x => (inducedMap D).2 ⟨x, hdom⟩, ?range_subset, ?continuous, ?injective⟩
86c85,86
<     continuity
---
>     apply Continuous.subtype_mk
>     exact continuous_id'
97c97
<     ∃ f : (ℕ → Bool) → α, range f ⊆ C ∧ Continuous f ∧ Function.Injective f := by
---
>     ∃ f : (ℕ → Bool) → α, Set.range f ⊆ C ∧ Continuous f ∧ Function.Injective f := by
```

The last line corresponds to me not having kept the `Set` namespace opened.
I suppose I could roll back these changes if they are problematic, I only followed my motto of cleaning up code as I go.

I would also suggest that PRs to split files don't make any other changes; this makes it easier to find out when actual changes were made. You other changes are probably also welcome, but should be separated out.
Alright, I've reduced this down to only the split; the style fixes and the performance optimization will have to wait, I guess

Pull request successfully merged into master.

Build succeeded:
  * [Build](https://github.com/leanprover-community/mathlib4/actions/runs/7893195817/job/21541300532)
  * [Check all files imported](https://github.com/leanprover-community/mathlib4/actions/runs/7893195817/job/21541300767)
  * [Lint style](https://github.com/leanprover-community/mathlib4/actions/runs/7893195817/job/21541301289)

pullRequest.title: [Merged by Bors] - refactor(Topology): split Topology.Perfect into two modules

source.title: Replace instances of `∀ x, NeBot (𝓝[≠] x)` with instances of `PerfectSpace α`
